qas.question: Where was the disease spreading between 1348 and 1350?

Who did the Kingdom of Poland trade with?

context: From Italy, the disease spread <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>northwest<a0_2/><a0_1/> across Europe<a0_0/>, striking France, <b9_0>Spain<b9_0/>, <b6_0>Portugal<b6_0/> and <b8_0>England<b8_0/> by <b5_0>June 1348<b5_0/>, then turned and spread east through <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Germany and Scandinavia<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> from 1348 to 1350. It was introduced in Norway in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>1349<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> when a ship landed at Askøy, then spread to Bjørgvin (modern Bergen) and Iceland. Finally it spread to <a1_0>northwestern <a1_1><a1_2>Russia<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> in <b7_0>1351<b7_0/>. The plague was somewhat less common in <a2_0>parts of Europe that had <a2_1><a2_2>smaller trade relations with their neighbours<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, including the Kingdom of Poland, the majority of the Basque Country, isolated parts of Belgium and the Netherlands, and isolated alpine villages throughout the continent.
